DOC.brief_summary: This study aim investigate predictive value novel biomarkers contrast-enhanced ultrasonography early detection abdominal end-organ ( kidney intestinum ) hypoperfusion ischemia patient undergo endovascular aortic repair ( EVAR ) aortic aneurysm dissection . In context , patient monitor renal biomarkers ( TIMP-2 , IGFBP7 ) intestinal biomarkers ( plasmatic intestinal fatty acid bind protein ( i-FABP ) ) local tissue perfusion assess use contrast-enhanced ultrasonography ( CEUS ) . The ultimate goal study early identification patient develop one complication , may facilitate timely intervention improve outcome .
DOC.brief_title: Kidney Intestinal Markers Early Detection Organ Injury After Endovascular Aortic Repair
DOC.criteria: Existence aortic aneurysm need repair indicate treat vascular surgeon Aortic stenting involve origin mesenteric ( i.e . superior inferior mesenteric artery ) kidney artery Central line present perform repeat blood collection Written inform consent obtain . Preexisting severe liver kidney injury ( define spontaneous international normalize ratio ( INR ) > 2 creatinine > 2 mg/dl renalreplacement therapy preoperative course . ) Known allergy ultrasound contrast medium ( exclusion CEUS marker evaluation ) Anemia hemoglobin concentration < 7g/dl Patients < 18 year age Patients able give write informed consent
